Feel free to mix and match.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-cookie-in-a-mug.html#faq-question-1706192497267", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-cookie-in-a-mug.html#faq-question-1706192497267", "name": "Can this dessert be made ahead?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "No, this microwave dessert is best made immediately before serving. It will dry out as it sits.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Chocolate Chip Cookie In A Mug", "author": {"@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/#/schema/person/d09ca52c9e790675f71c46404845af62"}, "description": "Get your chocolate fix fast with this warm and gooey chocolate chip cookie in a mug recipe. No need to turn on the oven!", "datePublished": "2021-07-07T17:23:29+00:00", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/07/Chocolate-Chip-Cookie-in-a-Mug-scaled.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/07/Chocolate-Chip-Cookie-in-a-Mug-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/07/Chocolate-Chip-Cookie-in-a-Mug-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/07/Chocolate-Chip-Cookie-in-a-Mug-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "recipeYield": ["1"], "prepTime": "PT5M", "cookTime": "PT1M", "totalTime": "PT6M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon unsalted butter", "2 tablespoons (packed) dark brown sugar", "1/8 teaspoon vanilla extract", "Pinch salt", "1  egg yolk", "3 tablespoons all-purpose flour", "Pinch baking soda", "1 heaping tablespoon semisweet chocolate chips"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the butter in a mug (an 8-oz/120-ml) mug is the perfect size, but larger will work too) and melt in the microwave for about 30 seconds. Using a small spoon, stir in the brown sugar, vanilla, and salt (don&#39;t worry if it looks a little separated). Add the egg yolk and stir until smooth. Stir in the flour and baking soda. Stir in two-thirds of the chocolate chips, and then sprinkle the remaining chips on the top. Microwave on high heat for about 45 seconds, until the dough puffs and looks dry. Remove from the microwave and let cool for a few minutes before eating. (The cookie should be eaten warm; it dries out once cool.)", "name": "Place the butter in a mug (an 8-oz/120-ml) mug is the perfect size, but larger will work too) and melt in the microwave for about 30 seconds. Using a small spoon, stir in the brown sugar, vanilla, and salt (don&#39;t worry if it looks a little separated). Add the egg yolk and stir until smooth. Stir in the flour and baking soda. Stir in two-thirds of the chocolate chips, and then sprinkle the remaining chips on the top. Microwave on high heat for about 45 seconds, until the dough puffs and looks dry. Remove from the microwave and let cool for a few minutes before eating. (The cookie should be eaten warm; it dries out once cool.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chocolate-chip-cookie-in-a-mug.html#wprm-recipe-77037-step-0-0"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "4.5", "ratingCount": "63", "reviewCount": "15"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Fun, easy, and tasty. I found that letting them cool for only 5 minutes (instead of the recommended 10) helped them release more easily. If they stick, take a butter knife or offset spatula and run it around the edges; and instead of pulling the muffins out of the pan, turn the pan over and knock it gently on the counter until the muffins drop out. Or, use paper liners and call it a day (but still butter the top of the pan!). I also found that the recipe is perfect for 12 muffin cups without the nuts; when you add the nuts, the muffins run into each other a bit, making them difficult to remove. So, if you're adding the nuts, you might want to bake the muffins in two pans, filling 6 cups in one pan and 7 in the other, for a total of 13 muffins.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/maple-muffins.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The muffins can be frozen in an airtight container or sealable plastic bag for up to 3 months. Let them sit for 20 minutes to an hour. During this time, the clams will expel sand from inside their shells. When you\u2019re ready to cook, lift each clam from the water and rinse it, scrubbing if necessary, to get rid of any grit from the surface. Use food coloring to tint the icing and then add water, little by little, to get the right consistency.  Use a thicker icing for details and outlines and a thinner icing for \"flooding,\" or fully covering the surface of the cookies. ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/about-jenn-segal"]}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#faq-question-1713895066035", "position": 1, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#faq-question-1713895066035", "name": "Can lemon berry parfaits be made ahead?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Absolutely! You can assemble the parfaits ahead of time and refrigerate them for several hours before serving. Just hold off on adding the optional cookie and fresh mint until right before serving. Also, both the lemon curd and whipped cream can be made in advance and refrigerated separately. The curd will keep in the fridge for up to 2 weeks, while the whipped cream will keep for a few days. If you're not assembling the parfaits immediately, you may need to briefly whip the whipped cream again to get it back to its original volume before combining it with the lemon curd.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#faq-question-1713977841384", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#faq-question-1713977841384", "name": "Can I use frozen berries instead of fresh?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Unfortunately, frozen berries won't work here. Frozen berries tend to release liquid as they thaw, potentially making the parfait too watery and affecting its texture.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#faq-question-1713977988763", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#faq-question-1713977988763", "name": "Can I use other fruits in the lemon berry parfaits.", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "For the best results, I recommend sticking with berries here. Also, keep in mind that the parfaits are only as good as the berries you make them with. I like to use a combination of raspberries, strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries but only if they're all sweet and juicy. (If you get any bits of cooked egg, pass the mixture through a fine sieve to remove.) Stir in the lemon zest and pour into a shallow bowl. Be sure the lemon mixture is completely cool; then, using a rubber spatula, gently fold it into the whipped cream.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-berry-parfaits.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place a large spoonful of berries into each glass (leave room for 2 layers of berries and 2 layers of cream) and top with a generous dollop of lemon cream. Add the dry ingredients and buttermilk-cherry mixture and stir on low speed until just combined. Do not overmix. "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#faq-question-1720016642405", "name": "Can I assemble pierogi ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Sure! Uncooked assembled pierogi can also be made ahead and kept in the refrigerator for up to two days. Place them in a single layer between sheets of parchment or wax paper in an airtight container, or on a baking sheet covered tightly with plastic wrap. To prevent sticking, be sure they don't touch. The uncooked pierogi can also be frozen for up to 3 months. After sealing the pierogi, freeze them on the baking sheet until solid, a few hours. Transfer the frozen pierogi to an airtight container. Just make sure to wrap it tightly in plastic wrap or store it in an airtight container to prevent it from drying out. When you\u2019re ready to use it, let the dough come to room temperature before rolling it out. You can also freeze the dough for longer storage\u2014just thaw it in the fridge overnight before using. The options for pierogi fillings are virtually endless! While potato and cheese is a classic favorite, sauerkraut and mushrooms are also popular choices. Keep in mind that if you plan to use any veggies, they should first be finely chopped, seasoned, and saut\u00e9ed. You can also get creative with the cheese and swap out cottage cheese for cheddar or ricotta. If you're comfortable improvising, go for it, but if you feel more confident following a recipe, just do a quick search online for pierogi fillings.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}]}, "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-48626", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal "}, "name": "Pierogi", "description": "Learn to make authentic pierogi, the Polish dumplings filled with creamy potatoes and cheese, then topped with caramelized onions\u2014a dish that's as comforting as it is delicious!", "prepTime": "PT1H", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT1H30M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "2 pierogi", "calories": "126", "fatContent": "3 g", "carbohydrateContent": "21 g", "proteinContent": "4 g", "saturatedFatContent": "1 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "2 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "203 mg", "cholesterolContent": "22 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Dough: In a large bowl, mix the flour and salt. Add the water into a liquid measuring cup that holds at least 2 cups of liquid. Add the eggs to the water and whisk with a fork until evenly combined. Add the water/egg mixture to the dry ingredients and stir with a fork to evenly moisten until the ingredients come together into a loose, shaggy mass. Using your hands, knead the dough in the bowl until it comes together into a ball. Lightly dust a clean work surface with flour. Invert the dough onto the surface and knead for 1 to 2 minutes, dusting with more flour as necessary, until smooth and elastic. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Filling: Melt the butter in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and season with \u215b teaspoon salt and a few grinds of black pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until golden brown and softened, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Set aside about 1 cup of onions for the garnish.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, combine the onions from the skillet with the mashed potatoes, cottage cheese, 1 teaspoon salt, and \u00bc teaspoon pepper. Mix well.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll and cut the dough: Divide the dough into two even pieces. (Wrap one piece back in plastic wrap while you work with the other piece.) Dust some flour onto a clean work surface and onto a baking sheet (that will hold the pierogi), then roll out one portion of dough as thin as possible, about 1/16 inch. Using a 3-inch cookie cutter or inverted glass, cut out as many disks of dough as you can. Remove the scraps and wrap them in plastic wrap (you'll re-roll them later).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Assemble the pierogi: Have a small bowl of water nearby to help moisten the dough edges if necessary. Working with one dough disk at a time, spoon a scant tablespoon of filling onto the center of the disk. Fold the dough in half over the filling, creating a crescent shape. To seal, pinch the top edges together firmly. Then continue sealing down both sides using a pinch-and-twist method: with your thumb and forefinger, pinch a small section of dough near the top, twist it slightly upward, and press it into the next section of dough. Repeat this pinch-and-twist motion all the way down both sides to create a secure, sealed, and very thin edge. Once sealed, place the pierogi on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat this process for the remaining dough disks and filling. Work fairly quickly, as the pierogi can be harder to seal if they begin to dry out. Moisten the inside of half the disk only if necessary to help the dough adhere.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Unwrap the remaining dough and repeat the process. You can re-roll the scraps one time by forming them into a ball and rolling them out again, but avoid rolling them out more than once, as this can make the dough tough.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook the pierogi: In a large pot, bring 3 quarts of salted water to a boil over high heat. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add a single layer of pierogi to the boiling water, stirring gently to ensure they don't stick together. Let them cook for 4 to 5 minutes. Use a slotted spoon or spider strainer to transfer the cooked dumplings to a tray or baking sheet and toss with a light coating of oil to prevent sticking. Repeat with the remaining pierogi.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you'd like to pan-fry the pierogi after boiling them, work in batches. Melt 1 to 2 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat until it begins to crackle. Add the boiled pierogi in a single layer, ensuring they don't overlap, and cook until crisp and golden, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Repeat with the remaining pierogi, adding more butter as needed. Serve hot, topped with reserved onions and parsley or dill (if using), and with sour cream on the side.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: Pierogi dough can be made up to 2 days ahead of time and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator. When you\u2019re ready to use it, let the dough come to room temperature before rolling it out. You can also freeze the dough for longer storage\u2014just thaw it in the fridge overnight before using. Uncooked assembled pierogi can also be made ahead and kept in the refrigerator for up to two days. Place them in a single layer between sheets of parchment or wax paper in an airtight container, or on a baking sheet covered tightly with plastic wrap. Be sure they don't touch to prevent sticking. The uncooked pierogi can also be frozen for up to 3 months. After sealing the pierogi, freeze them on the baking sheet until solid, a few hours. Transfer the frozen pierogi to an airtight container. When ready to cook, extend the boiling time to 7 to 8 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: To get 1 cup of mashed potatoes, you\u2019ll need to begin with 1 pound of yellow potatoes, peeled and cut into \u00bd-inch cubes. Bring a medium pot of water to a boil. Add the potatoes and boil until tender, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain in a colander, then transfer back to the pot and heat over medium-low heat, mashing with a potato masher, until any moisture has evaporated, and the potatoes are mashed, 1 to 2 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Nutritional information does not include saut\u00e9ing or optional serving ingredients.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pierogi.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}], "recipeIngredient": ["4 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off, plus more for kneading and rolling", "1 teaspoon salt", "1 cup room temperature water", "2 large eggs", "3 tablespoons unsalted butter", "3 medium yellow onions (1\u00bd pounds), finely diced", " Salt and freshly ground black pepper", "1 cup mashed waxy potatoes, from 1 lb of yellow potatoes (see note)", "1 cup cottage cheese", " Vegetable oil (to prevent sticking)", " Unsalted butter", " Fresh parsley or dill", " Sour cream"], "recipeYield": "44 to 46 pierogi", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/06/pierogi-1200x1553.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/06/pierogi-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/06/pierogi-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2024/06/pierogi-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "5"}, "datePublished": "2024-09-19T07:12:35-04:00", "keywords": "", "recipeCuisine": "Polish", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

You can also gently squeeze the tomato half to push out the seeds. Remove the cores and dice the tomatoes, then add it to the bowl with the tomato juices/seeds along with the drained onions and remaining salad ingredients. Toss well. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/summer-gazpacho-salad.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Chill the salad the refrigerator for at least 1\u00bd hours and up to 4 hours to allow the flavors to marry. During this time, the vegetables will exude more juice so you'll need to taste and adjust the seasoning with salt, pepper, balsamic vinegar, and more Tabasco before serving, if necessary. Spoon the vegetables and dressing into bowls and serve cold with soup spoons. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish and smooth the surface with the back of a spoon or spatula. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until puffed and lightly golden. Cool slightly in the pan on a wire rack, then cut into pieces and serve warm. Cornbread tastes best when served right out of the oven, but leftovers can be wrapped in foil and reheated in a 350-degree oven for 10 to 15 minutes.", "name": "In a small bowl, break up the eggs with a wire whisk, then add the milk and whisk to combine. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-butternut-squash-polenta.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the squash, milk, salt and pepper and bring to a boil.  Reduce the heat to medium and slowly add the cornmeal in a thin stream while whisking continuously. (I find it easiest to lightly tap the measuring cup of polenta against the pot so that it sprinkles in.) Reduce the heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently with a whisk, for about 5 minutes or until polenta is smooth and thickened.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-butternut-squash-polenta.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the heat and stir in cheese and remaining 2 tablespoons of butter.  Serve immediately topped with a bit of butter, more cheese, and herbs (if using). If serving later, place a piece of plastic wrap directly over the polenta to prevent a film from forming and reheat on the stovetop when ready to serve. (You will need to whisk well and add some water or milk to thin it out to the desired consistency when you reheat it.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/creamy-butternut-squash-polenta.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you can't find pur\u00e9ed squash, pur\u00e9e it in a food processor or blender. "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "I find that it\u2019s hard to get an accurate read on a meat thermometer for rack of lamb, so I\u2019d suggest using the timing guidelines given here instead of (or at least in addition to) an instant-read thermometer. The USDA recommends cooking lamb to a temperature of at least 145\u00b0F/63\u00b0C, but many people prefer it rarer. I think an internal temperature of 135\u00b0F/57\u00b0C (medium) is perfect, as the meat continues to rise several degrees while resting. With your exhaust fan on, sear the lamb for 4 minutes on each side, or until nicely browned. Don\u2019t worry about searing the ends; they\u2019ll brown in the oven. (The bones of the racks will hang over the edges of the skillet; that\u2019s okay.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the panko with the remaining teaspoon of oil, the thyme, \u00bc teaspoon salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Toss until the panko is well coated with the oil and seasonings.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a spoon or brush, spread the mustard all over the meat \u2013 you can do this right in the pan (after you\u2019ve removed it from the heat), using tongs to maneuver the racks \u2013 then arrange the racks fat/meatier-side up in the skillet. Sprinkle the panko mixture over the mustard coating on the top and sides of the racks (don\u2019t worry about the bottom sides), pressing with your hands to adhere.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Slide the pan into the oven and roast for 15 to 18 minutes, or until a thermometer inserted into the center of one of the roasts registers between 135\u00b0F/57\u00b0C (medium) and 140\u00b0F/60\u00b0C (medium-well). Keep in mind that these temperatures account for the fact that the temperature will continue to rise several degrees while the meat rests. Transfer the racks to a cutting board, cover with foil to keep warm, and let rest for 10 minutes. Cut into single or double chops.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: The only time-consuming part of the recipe trimming the fat and silver skin off the racks. I recommend asking your butcher to do this for you, but if you have to do it yourself, this is a good <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wPLxMuO2Cow\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">tutorial</a>. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you don\u2019t have an ovenproof skillet, transfer the racks to a foil-lined baking sheet before roasting.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: I find that it\u2019s hard to get an accurate read on a meat thermometer for rack of lamb, so I\u2019d suggest using the timing guidelines given here instead of (or at least in addition to) a thermometer. The USDA recommends cooking lamb to a temperature of at least 145\u00b0F/63\u00b0C, but many people prefer it rarer. I think an internal temperature of 135\u00b0F/57\u00b0C (medium) is perfect, as the meat continues to rise several degrees while resting. If you'd prefer, cook a bit longer to meet USDA guidelines.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/rack-of-lamb-with-dijon-panko-crust.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}], "recipeIngredient": ["Two 8-rib \"frenched\" lamb rib racks (1\u00bd to 2 pounds each), trimmed of fat and silver skin (see note)", " Salt", " Freshly ground black pepper", "2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon  olive oil", "2 tablespoons  Dijon mustard", "\u00bd cup  panko", "\u00bc teaspoon  dried thyme (or \u00be teaspoon finely chopped fresh thyme)"], "recipeYield": "4", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/04/Rack-of-Lamb-1200x1500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/04/Rack-of-Lamb-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/04/Rack-of-Lamb-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/04/Rack-of-Lamb-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.75, "ratingCount": "20"}, "datePublished": "2022-04-07T08:25:18-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas, Cookbook 2 Recipe, Easter, New Year's Eve, Panko", "recipeCuisine": "French", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Process for about 20 seconds to combine; be sure no lumps of brown sugar remain.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-scones-spiced-pumpkin-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the cold butter into \u00bd-inch chunks. Add to the food processor and pulse until the mixture resembles coarse meal \u2013 it should look unevenly crumbly with some pea-size chunks of butter within. Add the pumpkin mixture and pulse just until the mixture comes together. The dough will be very sticky, and you should still be able to see some pea-size clumps of butter.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-scones-spiced-pumpkin-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly flour a countertop or work surface. Dump the sticky scone dough onto the floured surface and dust the top lightly with more flour. Using your hands, gently knead the dough until it comes together into a smooth ball. Divide the dough in half. Dust your work surface with flour again and form each half into a 5-inch circle, about \u00be-inch thick. Using a sharp knife dusted with flour, slice each circle into 6 even wedges (cut each circle in half, then cut each half into thirds). If the dough starts to stick to the knife, dust the knife with more flour. Place the wedges on the prepared baking sheet. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-scones-spiced-pumpkin-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake the scones for 12 to 15 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-scones-spiced-pumpkin-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, make the glaze: In a medium bowl, whisk together the Confectioners' sugar, pumpkin, water, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and nutmeg until smooth. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-scones-spiced-pumpkin-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The dough can be frozen for up to 3 months. Put the dough wedges on a baking sheet, let set in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.)  To freeze after baking, let the scones cool completely and store in an airtight container, separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Before serving, remove the scones from the container and let them come to room temperature. (For best results, glaze after defrosting.)  **If you have the option to freeze the scones before or after baking them, you will get the best results if you freeze them before baking.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-scones-spiced-pumpkin-glaze.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bd cup canned pumpkin pur\u00e9e (I use Libby's)  ", "1 large egg", "3 tablespoons heavy cream", "1 tablespoon molasses, such as Grandma's Original ", "2 teaspoons vanilla extract", "2 cups all purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off with knife, plus more for dusting", "\u00bc cup plus 2 tablespoons dark brown sugar", "1 teaspoon baking powder", "\u00bd teaspoon baking soda", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "\u00be teaspoon ground ginger", "\u00be teaspoon ground cloves", "\u00bd teaspoon ground nutmeg", "1 stick (\u00bd cup) cold unsalted butter", "1\u00bd cups Confectioners' sugar", "3 tablespoons canned pumpkin pur\u00e9e", "1 tablespoon water", "\u00bc teaspoon ground cinnamon", "\u00bc teaspoon ground ginger", "\u00bc teaspoon ground cloves", "\u00bc teaspoon ground nutmeg"], "recipeYield": "12 small scones", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/10/Pumpkin-Scones-20-1638x2048-1-1200x1500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/10/Pumpkin-Scones-20-1638x2048-1-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/10/Pumpkin-Scones-20-1638x2048-1-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2021/10/Pumpkin-Scones-20-1638x2048-1-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.85, "ratingCount": "159"}, "datePublished": "2024-11-25T18:37:03-05:00", "keywords": "Fall, Halloween, Molasses, Pumpkin, Thanksgiving, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "American, British", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

(This can also be done in a small saucepan on the stove.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the dough hook, combine the egg, flour, potato flakes, dried milk, sugar, yeast, salt, and 3 tablespoons of the butter. Add the warm milk and water mixture and knead on medium-low speed for about 5 minutes until you have a smooth, soft dough. (Don\u2019t worry if the dough sticks a bit to the bottom of the bowl.) To remove the dough from the bowl, dust your hands with flour and scrape it out.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using your hands (dust them with more flour if necessary), shape the dough into a ball and place in a lightly greased bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or a damp kitchen towel and let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place until it's doubled in bulk, about 90 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Invert the dough onto a lightly floured work surface (it will deflate). Divide it into 12 even pieces (each piece should weigh 1\u00be to 2 ounces). Shape each piece of dough into a smooth ball by tucking and pinching the edges underneath to form a plump little bun.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Grease a 9-inch round baking pan with nonstick cooking spray. Place the rolls in the pan, arranging 8 evenly around the perimeter and 4 in the center. Cover the pan with plastic wrap or a damp kitchen towel and let the rolls rise until they're almost doubled in bulk, puffy, and touching, about 1 hour. Toward the end of the rising time, preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the remaining 1 tablespoon butter. Brush the rolls with the melted butter and bake for 23 to 25 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from the oven, and turn out onto a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature with butter. Store the rolls in a sealable plastic bag for several days at room temperature, or freeze for longer storage. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Freezing Instructions: You can freeze the rolls before or after baking. To freeze before baking, after completing the first rise and shaping the dough into 12 balls, put the dough balls on a baking sheet, pop them in the freezer for about an hour or until they are no longer tacky, and then put then in a resealable freezer bag; freeze for up to 3 months. When ready to bake, thaw the dough balls at room temperature for a minimum of 3 hours. Once thawed, place the dough balls in the baking dish for the second rise and proceed with recipe. To freeze the baked rolls, let them cool completely, wrap tightly in aluminum foil, and place in a freezer bag. Freeze for up to 1 month. To thaw, remove the rolls from the freezer and let sit at room temperature for at least 3 hours. Place the foil-wrapped rolls in a preheated 350\u00b0F oven for 10 to 15 minutes, until warm.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/dinner-rolls.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bd cup milk", "\u00bc cup water", "1 egg", "2 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off, plus more for dusting", "\u00bd cup instant potato flakes", "2 tablespoons nonfat dried milk", "2\u00bd tablespoons sugar", "1\u00bc teaspoons instant, quick, or rapid-rise yeast", "1\u00bc teaspoons salt", "4 tablespoons unsalted butter, at room temperature, plus more for serving"], "recipeYield": "12 rolls", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/04/dinner-rolls-1-1200x973.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/04/dinner-rolls-1-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/04/dinner-rolls-1-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/04/dinner-rolls-1-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.95, "ratingCount": "44"}, "datePublished": "2023-04-05T17:25:30-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Christmas, Comfort Food, Easter, Thanksgiving, Yeast", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Directly on the baking sheet, rub the potatoes with the oil and sprinkle all over with \u00bd teaspoon of the salt. You can also squeeze the potatoes to see if they are soft (be careful; they're hot!). Discard 2 of the scooped potato skin halves (preferably the least perfect ones), and place the remaining 8 potato skin halves back on the baking sheet.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the butter, remaining 2 teaspoons of salt, and pepper to the hot potato flesh in the bowl. Add the egg yolks and mash until evenly combined. Using a spoon, stir in the cheese and the remaining scallions until evenly combined. The theory is that if you don\u2019t prick the potato, the steam can build up under the skin and cause the potato to explode in the oven. I don't prick my potatoes and have never had a potato explosion, but pricking won't harm the potatoes, so go ahead and prick them as insurance, if you like.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The potatoes can be stuffed ahead of time and refrigerated in a covered container for up to 2 days. When ready to serve, heat in a 400\u00b0F oven until the filling is warm throughout and crisp on top, 25 to 30 minutes. The stuffed potatoes can also be frozen in an airtight container for up to 3 months. Bake in a 400\u00b0F-oven directly from the freezer until hot throughout and crisp on top, 30 to 35 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["5 large russet potatoes, scrubbed clean of dirt, rinsed and dried", "2 teaspoons vegetable or olive oil", "2\u00bd teaspoons salt, divided", "\u00bd teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "1 stick (\u00bd cup)  unsalted butter, cut into chunks and softened", "\u2153 cup heavy cream", "2 large egg yolks", "1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese", "3 scallions, light and dark green parts, thinly sliced, divided", "\u00bd teaspoon paprika, for sprinkling"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-1200x812.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "16"}, "datePublished": "2022-11-02T20:04:13-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Cheese, Comfort Food", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

the oven to 400\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Set 1 tablespoon of the dark green scallions aside to use as a garnish.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prick each potato a few times all over with a fork, if you like (see note). Directly on the baking sheet, rub the potatoes with the oil and sprinkle all over with \u00bd teaspoon of the salt. Bake until tender when pierced in the center with a sharp knife (or until the center of the largest potato registers 205\u00b0F to 210\u00b0F), 60 to 70 minutes. You can also squeeze the potatoes to see if they are soft (be careful; they're hot!). Let sit until cool enough to handle, 5 to 10 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using a sharp knife, cut each potato in half so that the flatter, wider side will sit flat on the baking sheet. Scoop the flesh from each potato to within about \u00bc inch of the skins, and transfer the flesh to a large bowl. Discard 2 of the scooped potato skin halves (preferably the least perfect ones), and place the remaining 8 potato skin halves back on the baking sheet.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the butter, remaining 2 teaspoons of salt, and pepper to the hot potato flesh in the bowl. Using a potato masher or large fork, mash until the butter is melted and the potatoes are broken down. Add the heavy cream and mash until the cream is incorporated and the potatoes are creamy. Add the egg yolks and mash until evenly combined. Using a spoon, stir in the cheese and the remaining scallions until evenly combined. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spoon the filling evenly into the potato skins, mounding slightly in the center. Sprinkle with the paprika. Return to the oven and bake until the filling is heated through and slightly crisp on top, 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle with the reserved scallions and serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Conventional wisdom says that prior to baking, you have to prick potatoes with a fork a few times to allow steam to escape during baking. The theory is that if you don\u2019t prick the potato, the steam can build up under the skin and cause the potato to explode in the oven. I don't prick my potatoes and have never had a potato explosion, but pricking won't harm the potatoes, so go ahead and prick them as insurance, if you like.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The potatoes can be stuffed ahead of time and refrigerated in a covered container for up to 2 days. When ready to serve, heat in a 400\u00b0F oven until the filling is warm throughout and crisp on top, 25 to 30 minutes. The stuffed potatoes can also be frozen in an airtight container for up to 3 months. Bake in a 400\u00b0F-oven directly from the freezer until hot throughout and crisp on top, 30 to 35 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/twice-baked-potatoes.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}], "recipeIngredient": ["5 large russet potatoes, scrubbed clean of dirt, rinsed and dried", "2 teaspoons vegetable or olive oil", "2\u00bd teaspoons salt, divided", "\u00bd teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "1 stick (\u00bd cup)  unsalted butter, cut into chunks and softened", "\u2153 cup heavy cream", "2 large egg yolks", "1 cup shredded sharp Cheddar cheese", "3 scallions, light and dark green parts, thinly sliced, divided", "\u00bd teaspoon paprika, for sprinkling"], "recipeYield": "8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-1200x812.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2022/11/twice-baked-potatoes-3-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "16"}, "datePublished": "2022-11-02T20:04:13-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Cheese, Comfort Food", "recipeCuisine": "American", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Finally, beat in the remaining flour mixture. Scrape down the sides of the bowl, and give a quick mix to make sure all of the ingredients are well-incorporated.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-buttermilk-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Divide the thick batter into the prepared pans and smooth with a rubber spatula. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-buttermilk-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make the glaze: in a medium bowl, whisk together the confectioners' sugar and lemon juice. Add more confectioners' sugar or lemon juice as necessary to make a thick but pourable glaze (it should be a little thicker than you'd think, about the consistency of molasses or honey). Spoon the glaze over the top of the cake, letting it drip down the sides. Let the cakes sit for about one hour to allow the glaze to set before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-buttermilk-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-11"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If you\u2019d like to make your own buttermilk, check out the easy method <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/how-to/how-to-make-buttermilk.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">here</a>.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-buttermilk-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-12"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> You'll need 4 to 5 large lemons for the entire recipe.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-buttermilk-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-13"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The cakes can be made up to 1 day ahead of time and stored in a cake dome or airtight container at room temperature. They can also be frozen (without the final glaze) for up to 3 months. After they are completely cooled, double-wrap securely with aluminum foil or plastic freezer wrap, or place them in a heavy-duty freezer bag. Thaw overnight on the countertop before serving. (Add the syrup before the cake is frozen and add the glaze after the cake is thawed.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/lemon-buttermilk-pound-cake.html#fv-recipe-step-14"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups all-purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled-off with a knife", "\u00bd teaspoon baking soda", "\u00bd teaspoon salt", "1 cup buttermilk (low-fat is fine) (see note)", "2 tablespoons (packed) grated lemon zest (see note) ", "2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice", "2 sticks (1 cup) unsalted butter, softened", "2\u00bc cups granulated sugar", "3  large eggs", "2 tablespoons water", "2 tablespoons granulated sugar", "2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice", "1 cup confectioners' sugar", "2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice"], "recipeYield": "Two {8\u00bd x 4\u00bd-inch|21x11-cm} loaves, about 16 servings ", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Lemon-Pound-Cake-10-1200x926.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Lemon-Pound-Cake-10-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Lemon-Pound-Cake-10-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2019/04/Lemon-Pound-Cake-10-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.78, "ratingCount": "1034"}, "datePublished": "2019-04-08T10:47:34-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Buttermilk, Easter, July 4th, Labor Day, Lemons, Memorial Day, Mother's Day, New Year's Day, Picnic, Potluck", "recipeCuisine": "American, Southern", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

(If the dough is crumbly from chilling longer than the recommended time, knead it slightly with your hands to make it more pliable.) Bake for 12 to 14 minutes, rotating the pans from top to bottom and front to back halfway through baking, until the cookies are pale on top and lightly golden on the bottom. Let the cookies cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. When the cookies are cool, use a small fine sieve to dust the cookies all over with confectioners' sugar. (Alternatively, gently roll the cookies in the confectioners' sugar until coated.) Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days. Dust the cookies again with confectioners' sugar before serving. Roll the dough into balls, let set on a baking sheet in the freezer, then place in a sealable bag and press out as much air as possible. Bake as needed directly from the freezer. (Allow 1 to 2 minutes longer in the oven.) To freeze the cookies after baking, let the cookies cool completely and store in an airtight container separating layers with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Stir until well combined, using your fingertips if necessary to be sure no lumps of brown sugar remain. Press into the bottom and 1 in (2.5 cm) up the sides of the prepared pan. Bake the crust for 10 minutes, until set.  Remove the crust from the oven and set aside. Reduce the oven temperature to 325\u00b0F (165\u00b0C).", "name": "Make the crust: In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, brown sugar, and salt. Check to make sure your oven has cooled to 325\u00b0F (165\u00b0C), then bake for 40 to 45 minutes, until the filling is set but still a little jiggly in the center. (An instant-read thermometer, inserted into the filling about 1&quot; in from the edge, should read between 180\u00b0 to 190\u00b0F/82 to 88\u00b0C.) The cheesecake will continue to cook as it cools. Remove the bars from the oven, and cool at room temperature for 30 minutes. Refrigerate until cold, at least 6 hours but preferably overnight.", "name": "Pour the batter into the slightly cooled crust. Add the pieces of butter. Using your fingertips, rub the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs with pea-sized clumps of butter within. Stir in the butterscotch chips and pecans. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, then add the cream mixture. Use a rubber spatula to mix until the dough comes together. It should be a bit sticky, almost like chocolate chip cookie dough. If it seems dry, add more cream little by little (no more than 2 tablespoons should be necessary).", "name": "In a large bowl, mix together the flour, salt, baking powder and brown sugar (use your fingers to rub the brown sugar into the mixture until no lumps remain). Add the pieces of butter. Using your fingertips, rub the butter into the dry ingredients until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs with pea-sized clumps of butter within. Stir in the butterscotch chips and pecans. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients, then add the cream mixture. Use a rubber spatula to mix until the dough comes together. It should be a bit sticky, almost like chocolate chip cookie dough. If it seems dry, add more cream little by little (no more than 2 tablespoons should be necessary).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/butterscotch-pecan-scones.html#wprm-recipe-74929-step-0-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Dust a clean, dry work surface with flour. Arrange the wedges on the prepared baking sheet, spacing evenly apart, and then sprinkle each one with about \u00bd teaspoon of Demerara sugar. Bake for 14 to 16 minutes, until lightly golden and firm to the touch. Let the scones cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. The scones are best enjoyed fresh on the day they are made, but leftovers can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to three days.", "name": "Press the dough into a circle about 1 inch (2.5 cm) high, then cut into 8 wedges. ", "prepTime": "PT0M", "cookTime": "PT0M", "totalTime": "PT0M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "164", "fatContent": "10g", "carbohydrateContent": "19g", "proteinContent": "4g", "saturatedFatContent": "1g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "13g", "fiberContent": "3g", "sodiumContent": "612mg", "cholesterolContent": "0mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the unpeeled garlic cloves in a small skillet over medium heat; cook, turning occasionally, until soft and blackened in spots, about 10 to 15 minutes. Cool, then remove skins (they should slip right off) and scrape off any char. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-gazpacho.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the peeled roasted garlic to the bowl of a food processor fitted with a metal blade; pulse, scraping down sides as necessary, until garlic is finely pur\u00e9ed. Add the chopped tomatoes and pulse until coarsely chopped. Do not overmix; the soup should be slightly chunky. Transfer the tomato mixture to an extra large bowl. Add the red bell peppers and cucumbers to the food processor and pulse until coarsely chopped; add to the bowl with the tomato mixture. Stir in the tomato juice, olive oil, red wine vinegar, salt, pepper and Tabasco. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Cover the bowl with saran wrap and chill until ready to serve. The longer it sits, the better it tastes. Serve cold.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/roasted-garlic-gazpacho.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}], "recipeIngredient": ["8 garlic cloves, unpeeled", "4  large vine-ripened tomatoes, cored and cut into 1-inch chunks", "2  red bell peppers, cored, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks", "1 English or hothouse cucumber, halved, seeded and cut into 1-inch chunks (do not peel)", "5 cups tomato juice, such as Campbells's (not the low sodium)", "\u00bc cup extra virgin olive oil, best quality such as Colavita or Lucini", "\u00bc cup red wine vinegar, best quality such as Pompeian Gourmet ", "1\u00bd teaspoons salt", "\u00bd teaspoon freshly ground black pepper", "\u00bd teaspoon Tabasco (optional)"], "recipeYield": "6-8", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-1200x1752.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2012/06/Roasted-Garlic-Gazpacho-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "20"}, "datePublished": "2012-06-21T08:08:14-04:00", "keywords": "Bell Peppers, Cucumbers, Picnic, Potluck, Summer, Tomatoes", "recipeCuisine": "Spanish", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

I have yet to sync our new oven and so had to bake the apples an extra ten minutes. Results were amazing, tender, sweet, serving them with French Vanilla ice cream tempered the sweetness. I made only four as I never serve guests an untried recipe, this one I will. The leftovers, reheated in the microwave were every bit as good as those hot from the oven! After I had heated them and added the ice cream I drizzled about 3/4 of an ounce of cognac over the ice cream! You can use either for this recipe. For pita pockets, be sure they are at least 6 inches wide. Trim off the top \u00bc of each round and stuff the burgers and toppings inside. Add the cauliflower and bring back to a boil. Cover, reduce the heat to low and steam for about 15 minutes, or until the cauliflower is very tender. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the cauliflower to a food processor. Add \u00bd cup (120 ml) of the broth from the pot, along with the butter, and process until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and freshly ground pepper. Add the thyme and process until just combined. Discard the remaining broth and transfer the cauliflower pur\u00e9e back to the pot.", "name": "In a medium pot, bring the chicken or vegetable broth and \u00bd teaspoon salt to a boil. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the cauliflower to a food processor. Add \u00bd cup (120 ml) of the broth from the pot, along with the butter, and process until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning with salt and freshly ground pepper. Add the thyme and process until just combined. Sprinkle each steak with \u00bc teaspoon salt and a few grinds of fresh black pepper. Cook until the first side is golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes. Flip the cauliflower steaks over and transfer the pan to the oven. [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 400\u00b0F and set a rack in the middle position. Remove the pie crust from freezer and thaw until just soft enough to easily prick with a fork, about 10 minutes. Prick the bottom and sides all over with a fork (pricking about an inch apart). Bake until fully cooked and lightly golden, 10 to 15 minutes. (Keep an eye on it...if it puffs up while cooking, gently prick it with a fork so it will deflate.) Don't worry if the crust cracks while baking; see my note below on how to fix it before proceeding. Set aside and turn oven down to 325\u00b0F.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-quiche.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the butter in a small skillet over medium-low heat. Spread the shallots over the bottom of the cooked crust, then sprinkle the shredded Gruyere over top. Scatter the spinach evenly over cheese, breaking up the clumps as best you can. Pour the egg and cream mixture over top.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-quiche.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake at 325\u00b0F degrees for 50 to 55 minutes until the custard is set and top is lightly golden. I then gather the spinach into a ball and squeeze it dry. It takes a few minutes of squeezing and re-squeezing to get all the water out. Be patient...you need the spinach completely dry, otherwise your quiche will be watery.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-quiche.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> Don't panic if your crust cracks\u2014you can easily fix it. Make a smooth paste by mixing 1\u00bd tablespoons of flour with 1 tablespoon softened butter. Use your fingers to patch up and fill any cracks, then place the crust back in the oven for a minute or so to set. It should be good as new.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spinach-quiche.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make-Ahead Instructions:</strong> This quiche can be made up to a day ahead of time and refrigerated. (Alternatively, carefully drain the hot water, then place the pan in the sink and run cold water over the eggs for 1 to 2 minutes. Drain, refill with fresh cold water, and let stand until the eggs are room temperature, about 10 minutes.) Gently crack the eggs all over and peel under running water (see peeling hack below). Add the chopped eggs, celery, scallions, and parsley. Using a rubber spatula, fold to combine. Taste and adjust seasoning, if necessary. Serve or refrigerate until ready to use. Pour the nuts into mixing bowl large enough to hold all of the ingredients, and set aside to cool. (Don't leave the nuts in the pan, as the residual heat may cause them to burn.) Transfer the minced vegetables to the sieve and use a rubber spatula to press out as much liquid as possible. Add the strained vegetable mixture to the bowl with the nuts. Taste and adjust seasoning, then transfer to a serving bowl. Transfer the chicken, skin side down, to a cold 12-inch nonstick skillet. Set the soy sauce aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/filipino-chicken-adobo.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the skillet over medium-high heat and cook until the skin is crisp and dark golden, 8-10 minutes. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/filipino-chicken-adobo.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the chicken to a plate and discard the fat in the skillet. Wipe the pan clean with a paper towel. Pour the soy sauce-coconut milk mixture into the pan; add the garlic and bay leaves. Return the chicken to the skillet, skin side up, and bring to a gentle boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for about 35 minutes, or until the chicken registers 175 degrees. Transfer the chicken to a platter and keep warm by tenting loosely with aluminum foil.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/filipino-chicken-adobo.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fish out the bay leaves and skim any noticeable fat off the surface of the sauce. Return the skillet to medium-high heat and cook until the sauce is slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary (if it is too assertive, add a few tablespoons of water and/or a bit more sugar). Pour the sauce over the chicken and sprinkle with the scallions. Serve with rice. (Note: if you'd like the skin to be extra crispy, place the chicken breasts on a baking sheet and broil for a few minutes before serving.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/filipino-chicken-adobo.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Drumsticks, similar to chicken thighs in terms of flavor and juiciness, are a great alternative. "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#faq-question-1721917166867", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#faq-question-1721917166867", "name": "How do I avoid burning the garlic?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "To avoid burning the garlic, make sure to slice it evenly so it all cooks at the same rate. When the garlic and olive oil are heating up, pay close attention; as soon as the garlic starts to sizzle, immediately reduce the heat to medium-low. While it continues to cook, be sure to stir it frequently. The garlic should turn a light golden color, which typically takes just a few minutes. If the garlic starts to brown too quickly, reduce the heat immediately. Keep in mind that garlic can go from perfectly golden to burnt quite fast, so staying attentive during this step is crucial. Last, after removing the skillet from the heat and adding the red pepper flakes, make quick work of adding \u00bd cup of the reserved pasta water to the pan  (this will stop the garlic from cooking further).", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#faq-question-1721917871412", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#faq-question-1721917871412", "name": "Can I add protein to this dish?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Definitely! <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/perfectly-grilled-chicken-breasts.html\">Grilled chicken</a>, shrimp, or even <a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/how-to-cook-bacon-in-the-oven.html\">crispy bacon</a> would be great additions.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Spaghetti Aglio e Olio", "author": {"@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/#/schema/person/d09ca52c9e790675f71c46404845af62"}, "description": "Short on time but big on hunger? Add the spaghetti and cook, stirring occasionally, until it is al dente, 10 to 12 minutes. Before draining, reserve 1\u00bd cups of the pasta cooking water. Then, drain the spaghetti.", "name": "Cook the Spaghetti: Bring a large pot of water and 1 tablespoon of the salt to a boil. Then, drain the spaghetti.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#wprm-recipe-49073-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the Sauce: In a cold skillet large enough to hold the pasta (a 12-inch saut\u00e9 pan is ideal), combine the olive oil and garlic. Cook over medium heat until the garlic begins to sizzle. Then, immediately reduce the heat to medium-low and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the garlic turns lightly golden, 3 to 4 minutes. Be careful not to let the garlic burn. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the red pepper flakes. Add about \u00bd cup of the reserved pasta water to the skillet to stop the garlic from cooking further.", "name": "Prepare the Sauce: In a cold skillet large enough to hold the pasta (a 12-inch saut\u00e9 pan is ideal), combine the olive oil and garlic. Cook over medium heat until the garlic begins to sizzle. Then, immediately reduce the heat to medium-low and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until the garlic turns lightly golden, 3 to 4 minutes. Be careful not to let the garlic burn. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the red pepper flakes. Add about \u00bd cup of the reserved pasta water to the skillet to stop the garlic from cooking further.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#wprm-recipe-49073-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Combine the Pasta and Sauce: Add the drained pasta to the skillet with the garlic oil, along with \u00be cup of the reserved cooking water and the remaining \u00be teaspoon of salt. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until the pasta absorbs some of the sauce, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the remaining reserved cooking water if the pasta seems dry.", "name": "Combine the Pasta and Sauce: Add the drained pasta to the skillet with the garlic oil, along with \u00be cup of the reserved cooking water and the remaining \u00be teaspoon of salt. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until the pasta absorbs some of the sauce, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the remaining reserved cooking water if the pasta seems dry.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#wprm-recipe-49073-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Finish and Serve: Right before serving, add the chopped parsley and grated cheese to the pasta. Stir until the pasta is well coated and the sauce becomes creamy. Serve immediately, passing additional cheese at the table. Note that if the pasta sits too long in the pan after adding the cheese, the heat may cause the cheese to congeal and stick to the pan. While this isn&#39;t a major issue, to prevent it, serve the pasta right away, or transfer it to a serving bowl if there might be a delay before serving.", "name": "Finish and Serve: Right before serving, add the chopped parsley and grated cheese to the pasta. Stir until the pasta is well coated and the sauce becomes creamy. Serve immediately, passing additional cheese at the table. Note that if the pasta sits too long in the pan after adding the cheese, the heat may cause the cheese to congeal and stick to the pan. While this isn&#39;t a major issue, to prevent it, serve the pasta right away, or transfer it to a serving bowl if there might be a delay before serving.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/spaghetti-aglio-e-olio.html#wprm-recipe-49073-step-0-3"}], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": "5", "ratingCount": "5", "reviewCount": "5"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "reviewBody": "Incredible. Place the pan on a baking sheet for easy handling and set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-streusel-torte.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make the Filling:</strong> In a large bowl, whisk the eggs. Stir in the pecans and refrigerate until ready to use. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/pumpkin-streusel-torte.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the torte has baked for 30 minutes, remove it from the oven. Sprinkle the topping evenly over the partially baked filling (don't worry that the filling is still a bit liquid; the topping will not sink). Bake for 25 to 30 minutes more, until the filling is set and the topping is golden brown. Let the torte cool completely on a rack, about 4 hours. To serve, run a thin-bladed knife around the edge of the pan to loosen the torte from the sides, then remove the outer ring from the springform pan and transfer the torte to a platter. Slice into wedges and serve with sweetened whipped cream, if desired. Add the cilantro and pulse until the cilantro is chopped. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/stacked-beef-enchiladas.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To assemble: Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F and move the oven rack to the center position. Spoon half of the beef (and any juices) over the tortillas. Top with half of the sauce and \u2153 of the cheese. Repeat with another layer of tortillas, the remaining beef, remaining sauce, and \u2153 of the cheese. Top with the remaining tortillas. Spread the reserved sauce over the tortillas and cover completely. Sprinkle the remaining cheese evenly over top. Bake, uncovered, for 30 to 35 minutes, or until the casserole is heated through and the cheese is completely melted. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/stacked-beef-enchiladas.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Ground chipotle chile pepper is smoky and hot and makes this dish a little spicy. For a milder dish, replace the ground chipotle chile pepper with ground ancho chili pepper, which isn't as hot.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/stacked-beef-enchiladas.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezing Instructions: The casserole can be prepared ahead of time, tightly covered with foil, and refrigerated for up to two days or frozen for up to 3 months before baking (if frozen, defrost in the refrigerator before cooking). \r\n\r\nIt can also be fully baked, tightly covered with foil, and refrigerated for up to two days or frozen for up to 3 months. To reheat: defrost if necessary and heat the covered casserole in a 350\u00b0F oven for about 30 minutes, or until hot. If you'd rather reheat individual servings, small portions can be zapped in the microwave for 1 to 2 minutes. {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To the dressing, add all of the ingredients for the salad and toss well. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to a few hours. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary (you might need more salt, lemon or honey, depending on the sweetness of the carrots). Transfer to a serving dish and garnish with more fresh chopped herbs. Serve cold.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-carrot-chickpea-salad-citrus-mint-almonds.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: To toast the almonds, preheat the oven to 350\u00b0F. Microwave in 20-second intervals, stirring in between each bout of heat, until about 75% melted. Stir until smooth, allowing the residual heat in the bowl to melt the chocolate completely. (This technique ensures the chocolate mixture will not get too hot and scorch.) Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/fudgy-double-chocolate-meringues.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, beat the egg whites with the cream of tartar, vanilla and salt until soft peaks form when you lift the beaters (the peaks should be just starting to hold, and will melt back into themselves after a second). Gradually add the sugar, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form (the peaks will stand straight up when the beaters are lifted from the mixture). Pour the warm chocolate and chocolate chips into the bowl and fold with a spatula until the batter is uniform. Let the cookies cool for a few minutes on the baking sheets, and then transfer to a rack to cool completely. Add the salt and cumin and pulse until just slightly chunky. (If you left out some of the chili peppers, now's the time to taste and add more.) Add the cilantro and fresh lime juice, and pulse until the cilantro is chopped. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and more lime juice if necessary. Transfer to a bowl and serve warm, at room temperature, or slightly chilled. "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT45M", "recipeIngredient": ["1\u00bd pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts, (pounded \u00bc-in (6-mm) thick (see note), or chicken tenderloins)", "3 tablespoons all-purpose flour", "Salt", "Freshly ground black pepper", "1 tablespoon olive oil", "3 tablespoons unsalted butter, (divided)", "1 (8-oz) package pre-sliced bella or button mushrooms", "3 tablespoons finely chopped shallots, (from 1 medium shallot)", "2 cloves garlic, (minced)", "\u2154 cup chicken broth", "\u2154 cup dry Marsala wine", "\u2154 cup heavy cream", "2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme", "2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley, (for serving (optional))"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the flour, \u00be teaspoon salt, and \u00bc teaspoon pepper in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken to the bag; seal bag tightly and shake to coat chicken evenly. Set aside.", "name": "Place the flour, \u00be teaspoon salt, and \u00bc teaspoon pepper in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken to the bag; seal bag tightly and shake to coat chicken evenly. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-marsala.html#wprm-recipe-76313-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the oil and 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. (Use a stainless steel pan for the best browning. Nonstick will work too, but you won\u2019t get that nice golden color on the chicken.) Place the flour-dusted chicken in the pan, shaking off any excess first, and cook, turning once, until the chicken is golden and just barely cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes total. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside.", "name": "Heat the oil and 2 tablespoons of the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. (Use a stainless steel pan for the best browning. Nonstick will work too, but you won\u2019t get that nice golden color on the chicken.) Place the flour-dusted chicken in the pan, shaking off any excess first, and cook, turning once, until the chicken is golden and just barely cooked through, about 5 to 6 minutes total. Transfer the chicken to a plate and set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chicken-marsala.html#wprm-recipe-76313-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the remaining tablespoon of butter in the pan. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring frequently, until the mushrooms begin to brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the shallots, garlic, and \u00bc teaspoon of salt; cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. Add the broth, Marsala, heavy cream, thyme, \u00bc teaspoon salt, and &frac18; teaspoon of pepper; use a wooden spoon to scrape any brown bits from the pan into the liquid. Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, until the sauce is reduced by about half, slightly thickened, and darkened in color, 10 to 15 minutes (you\u2019re going for a thin cream sauce; it won\u2019t start to thicken until the very end of the cooking time). Add the chicken back to the pan, along with any juices that accumulated on the plate. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the chicken is warmed through and the sauce thickens a bit more, 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley, if using, and serve.", "name": "Melt the remaining tablespoon of butter in the pan. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring frequently, until the mushrooms begin to brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the shallots, garlic, and \u00bc teaspoon of salt; cook for 1 to 2 minutes more. Add the broth, Marsala, heavy cream, thyme, \u00bc teaspoon salt, and &frac18; teaspoon of pepper; use a wooden spoon to scrape any brown bits from the pan into the liquid. Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium and gently boil, uncovered, until the sauce is reduced by about half, slightly thickened, and darkened in color, 10 to 15 minutes (you\u2019re going for a thin cream sauce; it won\u2019t start to thicken until the very end of the cooking time). Add the chicken back to the pan, along with any juices that accumulated on the plate. Reduce the heat to low and simmer until the chicken is warmed through and the sauce thickens a bit more, 2 to 3 minutes. "Jennifer Segal "}, "name": "Oven-Steamed Mussels with Garlic and White Wine", "description": "Steamed mussels in a buttery, garlicky white wine broth make for a simple yet elegant dinner. Don\u2019t forget the crusty bread to soak up every last drop of that briny, flavorful sauce!", "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT35M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "693", "fatContent": "35 g", "carbohydrateContent": "22 g", "proteinContent": "55 g", "saturatedFatContent": "12 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "1 g", "fiberContent": "1 g", "sodiumContent": "1,351 mg", "cholesterolContent": "165 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set an oven rack in the lowest position and preheat the oven to 500\u00b0F. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oven-steamed-mussels-with-garlic-white-wine.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Set a large roasting pan on the stovetop over medium heat. Add the oil, garlic, and red pepper flakes and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 30 to 60 seconds. Do not brown. Add the wine, thyme, and bay leaves and boil until slightly reduced, about 1 minute. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oven-steamed-mussels-with-garlic-white-wine.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the salt and mussels. Cover the pan tightly with aluminum foil (remember the edges of the pan will be hot) and transfer to the oven. Roast until the majority of the mussels have opened, about 15 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oven-steamed-mussels-with-garlic-white-wine.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pan from the oven, and place a dishtowel over the handle to remind yourself that it's hot. Discard any unopened mussels. Using a wooden spoon, push the mussels to the edges of the pan. Add the butter to the center and stir until melted. Discard the thyme sprigs and bay leaves and stir in the parsley. Spoon the mussels and wine broth into bowls and serve with bread.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oven-steamed-mussels-with-garlic-white-wine.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: When a recipe calls for dry white wine, the best options are Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Grigio, or unoaked Chardonnay. Select a bottle that is inexpensive but still good enough to drink.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oven-steamed-mussels-with-garlic-white-wine.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: Most markets sell farm-raised mussels, which are easy to clean \u2014 in fact, they are usually already scrubbed and debearded. However, it\u2019s still a good idea to clean them prior to cooking. Simply put them in a colander and run them under cold running water, using your hands or a scrubbing brush to remove any sand or debris. If beards (the little tuft of fibers the mussel uses to connect to rocks or pilings) are present, cut or scrape them off with a paring knife, or use your fingers to pull them sharply down toward the hinged point of the shells.\r\n\r\nThe mussels should be tightly closed. If you see a mussel that is open, tap it gently against the counter; in a live mussel, this will trigger a reaction to close its shell. If the mussel doesn\u2019t slowly close, it has died and should be discarded. Discard any mussels with cracked shells as well.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oven-steamed-mussels-with-garlic-white-wine.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons  extra-virgin olive oil", "4  large garlic cloves, minced", " Pinch red pepper flakes", "1\u00bd cups dry white wine (see note)", "4 sprigs fresh thyme", "2 bay leaves", "Brimming \u00bc teaspoon salt", "4 pounds  mussels, scrubbed and debearded (see note)", "5 tablespoons  unsalted butter, cut into 5 pieces", "3 tablespoons finely chopped fresh Italian parsley", " Crusty bread, for serving"], "recipeYield": "2 to 4", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/07/Oven_steamed_mussels_garlic_white_wine-1200x1200.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/07/Oven_steamed_mussels_garlic_white_wine-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/07/Oven_steamed_mussels_garlic_white_wine-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2020/07/Oven_steamed_mussels_garlic_white_wine-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"https://shop.americastestkitchen.com/foolproof-fish.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\">Foolproof Fish: Modern Recipes for Everyone, Everywhere</a> (America's Test Kitchen, 2020)", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.92, "ratingCount": "25"}, "datePublished": "2020-07-23T07:22:31-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, White Wine", "recipeCuisine": "French, Italian", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]
