", "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT2H15M", "totalTime": "PT2H30M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "1/2 cup", "calories": "256", "fatContent": "21 g", "carbohydrateContent": "17 g", "proteinContent": "3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "9 g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "10 g", "fiberContent": "4 g", "sodiumContent": "503 mg", "cholesterolContent": "31 mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If using fresh tomatoes: Bring a large pot of water to a rolling boil. Fill a large bowl halfway-full with ice cubes and cold water. Using a sharp knife, cut a \u00bc-inch deep X on one end of each tomato. Place the scored tomatoes into the boiling water and cook until you see the skin starting to wrinkle and split, 1 to 2 minutes (be careful not to cook too long, or the tomatoes will become soft and difficult to handle). Using a slotted spoon, lift the tomatoes out of the pot and plunge them into the ice-cold water bath. Let sit for a few minutes to cool, then transfer the tomatoes to a cutting board and, using your hands, peel off their skins. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tomato-sauce-basil.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut the tomatoes into \u00bd-inch chunks (discard the cores at this point) and transfer them, along with all of their juices, into a Dutch oven or saucepan. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/tomato-sauce-basil.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To the chopped tomatoes, add the butter, olive oil, onions, garlic, salt, and sugar. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 1\u00bd to 2\u00bd hours, stirring occasionally and mashing the tomatoes, until the sauce is no longer watery. Remove and discard the onions. Using a wooden spoon or potato masher, mash any large chunks of tomatoes and garlic to make a slightly chunky and thick sauce. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Before serving, stir in the basil. pepper. Lightly dust with the flour, turning to coat both sides evenly.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a heavy flameproof roasting pan or ovenproof enameled cast-iron pot just large enough to hold the brisket, carrots, and dried fruits snugly, heat the oil over medium\u2011high heat. Add the brisket to the pan, fatty-side down, and sear until browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Using a pair of tongs and a large fork, flip the brisket over and sear the other side in the same manner.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the brisket to a platter, and then add the onions to the pan. (If the pan seems dry, add a few tablespoons of water.) Cook, stirring occasionally with a wooden spoon and scraping up any browned bits stuck to the bottom of the pan, until the onions are softened and golden brown, 10 to 15 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the brown sugar, paprika, cumin, ginger, coriander, cinnamon, and cayenne to the onions and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute more. Add 1 cup water and scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the pan.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove from the heat and place the brisket, fatty\u2011side up, and any accumulated juices from the platter on top of the onions. Spread the tomato paste evenly over the brisket, and then scatter the garlic around it. Cover the pan very tightly with heavy\u2011duty aluminum foil or a lid, transfer to the oven, and cook for 1\u00bd hours.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully transfer the brisket to a cutting board (leave the oven on). Using an electric or very sharp knife, cut the meat across the grain on a diagonal into thin slices (aim for 1\u20448 to \u00bc in thick). Return the slices to the pot, overlapping them at an angle so that you can see a bit of the top edge of each slice. The end result should resemble the original unsliced brisket leaning slightly backward. Scatter the carrots, apricots, prunes, and capers around the edges of the pot and baste with the sauce; cover tightly with the foil or lid and return to the oven.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lower the heat to 325\u00b0F and cook the brisket until it is fork\u2011tender, 1\u00be to 2\u00bd hours. Transfer the brisket to a serving platter, and then sprinkle with parsley. If you\u2019re not planning to serve the brisket right away, let it cool to room temperature and then cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Note: If the sauce seems greasy, transfer the meat and vegetables to a platter and cover with foil to keep warm. Pour the sauce into a bowl and let sit until the fat rises to the top. Using a small ladle, spoon out the fat. Pour the skimmed gravy back over the meat. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead Instructions: The brisket can be made up to 3 days ahead of time and refrigerated. Reheat the brisket in a 300\u00b0F oven until hot, about 45 minutes. Brisket also freezes well for up to 2 months; just be sure to defrost in the refrigerator 2 days ahead of time.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/moroccan-style-brisket-with-dried-fruit-capers.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}], "recipeIngredient": ["One  (4- to 6-lb) flat-cut brisket", "1 heaping Tbsp  kosher salt", "1 tsp  freshly ground black pepper", "1\u00bd Tbsp  all-purpose flour (okay to substitute matzo cake meal)", "3 Tbsp  vegetable oil", "5  medium yellow onions, cut into slices \u00bd in thick", "2 tsp  packed light brown sugar", "2 tsp  paprika", "1\u00bd tsp  ground cumin", "1\u00bc tsp  ground ginger", "\u00be tsp  ground coriander", "\u00be tsp  ground cinnamon", "\u00bc tsp  cayenne pepper", "2 Tbsp  tomato paste", "5  garlic cloves, roughly chopped", "6  carrots, peeled and quartered on the diagonal", "14  dried apricots", "12  pitted prunes", "2 Tbsp  capers, drained", "\u00bc cup  chopped fresh Italian parsley"], "recipeYield": "8 ", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/03/Moroccan-Style-Brisket-1200x1416.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/03/Moroccan-Style-Brisket-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/03/Moroccan-Style-Brisket-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2018/03/Moroccan-Style-Brisket-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "<a href=\"https://www.onceuponachef.com/cookbook-2\"><em>Once Upon a Chef, The Cookbook: 100 Tested, Perfected, and Family-Approved Recipes</em></a>", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.9, "ratingCount": "49"}, "datePublished": "2018-03-20T20:45:22-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Capers, Carrots, Cookbook Recipe, Dried Fruit, Jewish Holiday Recipes, Novideo, Passover", "recipeCuisine": "Jewish, Moroccan", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Refrigerate until ready to use.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/noodle-kugel.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F and set an oven rack in the middle position. Pour the custard mixture evenly over top. Cover the dish tightly with aluminum foil and bake for 35 minutes. Remove and discard the foil. The custard should be just set. Sprinkle the streusel topping evenly over the top, making sure to cover all the noodles. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes more, until the streusel topping is crisp. Let cool for about 20 minutes, then cut into squares and serve.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/noodle-kugel.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions: The kugel and topping can be assembled and stored separately in the fridge up to a day ahead of time, and then baked before serving. (The kugel with the streusel topping may also be fully cooked a day ahead of time and reheated, however the texture will be denser than if baked fresh. To reheat, cover with foil and place in a 325\u00b0F oven for 25 minutes; remove and discard the foil, and continue baking for 15 to 25 minutes more, or until warm throughout and crisp on top.) The baked kugel can also be frozen for up to 2 months. Allow it to cool completely. Then, wrap it tightly in aluminum foil or plastic wrap and place it in an airtight container or freezer bag. When you're ready to serve it, thaw the kugel in the refrigerator overnight, then reheat it in a 325\u00b0F-until warmed through.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/noodle-kugel.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup packed dark brown sugar", "1\u00bc cups  all purpose flour, spooned into measuring cup and leveled off", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "\u00bc teaspoon salt", "1 stick unsalted butter, cold, cut into \u00bd-inch chunks", "One 12-oz bag wide egg noodles", "4 large eggs", "One 8-oz container sour cream ", "One 8-oz package cream cheese, softened (microwave for 15 to 20 seconds to soften)", "2 cups half & half", "\u00bd cup granulated sugar", "1 teaspoon salt", "2 teaspoons vanilla extract", "\u00bd teaspoon ground cinnamon"], "recipeYield": "12 ", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/09/Jewish-Noodle-Kugel-1200x816.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/09/Jewish-Noodle-Kugel-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/09/Jewish-Noodle-Kugel-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/09/Jewish-Noodle-Kugel-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.82, "ratingCount": "49"}, "datePublished": "2017-09-27T13:50:39-04:00", "keywords": "Casserole, Comfort Food, Cream Cheese, Jewish Holiday Recipes, Sour Cream", "recipeCuisine": "Jewish", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

["https://www.onceuponachef.com/about-jenn-segal"]}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#faq-question-1706803622600", "position": 1, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#faq-question-1706803622600", "name": "What's the difference between ground ancho chile pepper and ground chipotle chile pepper?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Ground ancho chile pepper, made from dried poblano peppers, imparts a mild, sweet, and smoky flavor with a subtle heat. It's known for its deep red color and earthy tones. On the other hand, ground chipotle chile pepper, derived from smoked and dried jalape\u00f1os, offers a more intense smokiness with a noticeable heat and a hint of chocolatey undertones. The combination of both provides a complex and layered chili flavor.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#faq-question-1706803675494", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#faq-question-1706803675494", "name": "What is chuck roast?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Chuck roast is a cut of beef that comes from the shoulder area of the cow. It's known for its rich beef flavor and marbling of fat, which contributes to its tenderness when cooked. Look for meat with a good amount of white fat veins running through it. This marbling ensures that the meat stays tender and flavorful during the slow cooking process. Avoid using generically packaged \u201cstew meat,\u201d especially if it appears lean, as it's unlikely to become tender. While preparing the chuck roast, trim off the excess fat, but avoid over-trimming. Removing only the large flaps of fat is sufficient, as some fat is necessary to enrich the chili's flavor.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#faq-question-1706803839635", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#faq-question-1706803839635", "name": "Can I make chili con carne ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, the dish can be made up to 3 days ahead of time or frozen for up to 3 months. Before serving, defrost it in the refrigerator for 12 hours and then reheat it on the stovetop over medium heat until hot.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}]}, {"@context": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@id": "ouac-fv-recipe-16092", "@type": "Recipe", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jennifer Segal"}, "name": "Texas-Style Chili Con Carne", "description": "Tender chuck roast in a deeply-flavored and smoky sauce, Texas-style chili con carne is the ultimate beef chili. ", "prepTime": "PT45M", "cookTime": "PT3H35M", "totalTime": "PT4H20M", "nutrition": {"@type": "NutritionInformation", "servingSize": "", "calories": "644", "fatContent": "32g", "carbohydrateContent": "22g", "proteinContent": "66g", "saturatedFatContent": "11g", "unsaturatedFatContent": "", "sugarContent": "7g", "fiberContent": "3g", "sodiumContent": "1648mg", "cholesterolContent": "195mg"}, "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix the chili powders, cumin, oregano, coriander, cinnamon and cornmeal in a small bow and stir in \u00bd cup water to form a thick paste; set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Season the beef with the salt; set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large pot or Dutch oven, fry the bacon over medium heat, stirring frequently so it doesn't stick, until the fat renders and the bacon crisps, about 10 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove the bacon to a paper towel-lined plate. Pour all but a few teaspoons of fat from the pot into a small bowl; set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Increase the heat to medium-high. Sear the meat in three batches (it should be in a single layer), until well browned on one side, about 4 minutes per batch, adding more of the reserved bacon fat as necessary. (Hint: Once the meat is in the pan, don't stir or touch it \u2013 leaving it alone will allow it to develop a nice brown crust on one side.) Place the seared meat on a plate. Add about \u00bc cup of water to the pot (it will smoke), and scrape the bottom with a wooden spoon to release all of the flavorful brown bits. Pour the dark liquid over the seared meat.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to medium and add 3 tablespoons of the reserved bacon fat to the pot. Add the onions and cook, stirring frequently, until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and jalape\u00f1os and cook 2 minutes more. Add the reserved chili paste and saut\u00e9 until fragrant, a few minutes (it will look clumpy and stick to the bottom a bit \u2013 that's okay). ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the beef broth and stir with a whisk until the spice mixture is completely dissolved. Scrape the bottom of the pot with the whisk to release any spices. Stir in the the water, beer, crushed tomatoes, molasses and cocoa powder. Add the reserved bacon and seared beef (along with the juices from the beef on the bottom of the plate) back to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover, leaving the lid just barely ajar. Simmer, stirring occasionally so the bottom doesn't burn, until the meat is meltingly tender and the juices are thickened, 2\u00bd to 3 hours. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. Ladle the chile con carne into bowls and serve with cilantro, cheese, and lime wedges. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> When selecting the meat, be sure not to buy anything generically labeled \"stew meat.\" Also, you will lose about \u00bd pound after trimming the fat, so if you buy the meat already trimmed and cubed, you'll only need about 3\u00bd pounds. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Tip:</strong> To make bacon easier to chop, try placing it in the freezer for 15 to 20 minutes first. The colder it is, the easier it is to cut.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Note:</strong> Always be careful when handling jalape\u00f1o peppers. Wash your hands well when done and avoid touching your eyes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "<strong>Make-Ahead/Freezer-Friendly Instructions:</strong> The chili can be made up to 3 days ahead of time or frozen for up to 3 months. Before serving, defrost it in the refrigerator for 12 hours and then reheat it on the stovetop over medium heat until hot.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chili-con-carne.html#fv-recipe-step-10"}], "recipeIngredient": ["\u00bc cup ground ancho chile pepper", "1 tablespoon ground chipotle chile pepper", "2 tablespoons ground cumin", "2 teaspoons dried oregano", "1 teaspoon ground coriander", "\u00bd teaspoon  cinnamon", "\u00bc cup cornmeal", "1 (4-pound) beef chuck roast, trimmed of excess fat and cut into 1\u00bd-inch cubes (see note below)", "8 ounces (about 8 slices) bacon, cut into \u00bc-inch pieces (see tip below)", "2 teaspoons salt", "2  small yellow onions, cut into 1-inch chunks", "5 garlic cloves, chopped", "3  jalape\u00f1o chiles, cored, seeded and finely diced (see note) ", "4 cups (32 oz) low-sodium beef broth", "2 cups water, plus more for the chili paste and deglazing the pan", "1\u00bc cups lager beer", "1 cup canned crushed tomatoes", "1 tablespoon molasses, such as Grandma's Original ", "2 teaspoons natural unsweetened cocoa powder", " Fresh chopped cilantro", " Shredded Cheddar or Monterey Jack cheese", " Lime wedges"], "recipeYield": "4-6", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Chili-Con-Carne-18-1200x1800.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Chili-Con-Carne-18-scaled-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Chili-Con-Carne-18-scaled-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2015/01/Chili-Con-Carne-18-scaled-480x270.jpg"], "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 4.64, "ratingCount": "137"}, "datePublished": "2022-08-20T09:37:00-04:00", "keywords": "All Seasons, Bacon, Beer, Chuck Roast, Cocoa Powder, Comfort Food, Game Day, Jalape\u00f1os, Molasses, Stew, Tomatoes", "recipeCuisine": "American, Tex-Mex", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

Add the oil, garlic, lime zest, cumin, oregano, ancho chili powder, smoked paprika, and salt into the bag. Mash the outside of the bag with your hands to blend the marinade together. Add the tenderloins or pounded chicken breasts and seal shut, releasing any air in the bag. Using your hands, massage the marinade into meat until evenly coated. Place the bag back in the bowl and place in the refrigerator (the bowl protects against leakage); let the chicken marinate at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours.", "name": "Open a 1-gallon zip-lock bag and place in a medium bowl. Heat the oil in a large skillet (preferably not non-stick) over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions, peppers, salt, and sugar; cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables start to brown and a brown film forms around edges of the bottom of the pan, 8 to 10 minutes. Add \u00bc cup (60 ml) of water to the pan; scrape the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon to release any browned bits. Continue cooking for 3 to 4 minutes, until the water is evaporated and the pan starts to brown again; add \u00bc cup (60 ml) more water and cook a few minutes more, until the vegetables are tender-crisp. Season to taste with more salt and sugar if necessary. Set aside.", "name": "While the grill heats, cook the peppers. Heat the oil in a large skillet (preferably not non-stick) over medium-high heat. Add \u00bc cup (60 ml) of water to the pan; scrape the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon to release any browned bits. Continue cooking for 3 to 4 minutes, until the water is evaporated and the pan starts to brown again; add \u00bc cup (60 ml) more water and cook a few minutes more, until the vegetables are tender-crisp. ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/about-jenn-segal"]}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#faq-question-1706713527935", "position": 1, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#faq-question-1706713527935", "name": "What is the best type of mozzarella to use for baked ziti?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Whole milk mozzarella is best. You can purchase a plastic-wrapped brick of mozzarella (usually sold in the dairy case) and shred it yourself. To make it easier to work with, pop it in the freezer for 15 to 20 minutes prior to shredding. Or, to save time time, it's perfectly fine to use pre-shredded mozzarella; just be sure it is made from whole milk. Avoid fresh buffalo mozzarella, which is best suited for salads.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#faq-question-1706713513382", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#faq-question-1706713513382", "name": "Can I make baked ziti ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, the dish can be assembled, covered, and refrigerated for up to 2 days in advance. Bake, covered tightly with aluminum foil, in a 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) oven for 25 minutes. Then uncover and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes, until the cheese is lightly browned and the pasta is hot throughout.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#faq-question-1706713685596", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#faq-question-1706713685596", "name": "Can I freeze baked ziti?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Absolutely! Baked ziti is a great candidate for freezing, and it can be frozen for up to 3 months before or after baking. If you freeze before baking, thaw the dish in the refrigerator overnight and bake, covered tightly with aluminum foil, in a 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) oven for 25 minutes. Then uncover and bake for another 10 to 15 minutes, until the cheese is lightly browned and the pasta is hot throughout. To freeze after baking, let the dish cool completely, then cut it into individual portions or leave it whole. Wrap the portions tightly in plastic wrap or aluminum foil, or place them in an airtight container. To reheat, simply thaw in the refrigerator overnight and bake until heated through.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Recipe", "name": "Baked Ziti", "author": {"@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/#/schema/person/d09ca52c9e790675f71c46404845af62"}, "description": "Whip up my easy, crowd-pleasing baked ziti recipe\u2014it's perfect for cozy weeknights yet special enough for company, and an absolute superstar at potlucks!", "datePublished": "2024-01-11T09:24:54+00:00", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Baked-Ziti.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Baked-Ziti-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Baked-Ziti-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2017/10/Baked-Ziti-480x270.jpg"], "recipeYield": ["8", "8 to 10 servings"], "prepTime": "PT40M", "cookTime": "PT50M", "totalTime": "PT90M", "recipeIngredient": ["1 lb ziti noodles", "1\u00bd lbs ground spicy or sweet Italian sausage ((or removed from casings))", "4 cloves garlic, (minced)", "1 (28-oz) can crushed tomatoes", "1 teaspoon salt", "1\u00bd teaspoons sugar", "\u00bc teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes", "1 cup heavy cream", "1/3 cup plus 3 tablespoons grated pecorino Romano ((or Parmigiano Reggiano cheese), divided)", "1/3 cup chopped fresh basil, (plus more for serving)", "8 oz whole milk mozzarella cheese, (shredded (about 2 cups))"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the ziti noodles and cook according to the package directions for very al dente, about 7 minutes. (It will continue to cook in the oven, so you want to undercook it just a bit.) Drain and add the pasta back to the pot. Set aside.", "name": "Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the ziti noodles and cook according to the package directions for very al dente, about 7 minutes. (It will continue to cook in the oven, so you want to undercook it just a bit.) Drain and add the pasta back to the pot. Set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#wprm-recipe-72134-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) and set the oven rack in the middle position.", "name": "Preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) and set the oven rack in the middle position.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#wprm-recipe-72134-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat a large saut\u00e9 pan (preferably nonstick) over medium-high heat. Crumble the sausage into the pan and cook, breaking apart with a wooden spoon, until lightly browned and just cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the cooked sausage to a plate. Drain all but 1 tablespoon of the fat from the pan and set over low heat (if you don&#39;t have enough fat in the pan, add a tablespoon of olive oil). Add the 4 cloves of minced garlic and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until soft but not browned, about 1 minute. Add the can of crushed tomatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, 1\u00bd teaspoons sugar, and \u00bc teaspoon red pepper flakes and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.", "name": "Heat a large saut\u00e9 pan (preferably nonstick) over medium-high heat. Crumble the sausage into the pan and cook, breaking apart with a wooden spoon, until lightly browned and just cooked through, 5 to 6 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer the cooked sausage to a plate. Drain all but 1 tablespoon of the fat from the pan and set over low heat (if you don&#39;t have enough fat in the pan, add a tablespoon of olive oil). Add the 4 cloves of minced garlic and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until soft but not browned, about 1 minute. Add the can of crushed tomatoes, 1 teaspoon salt, 1\u00bd teaspoons sugar, and \u00bc teaspoon red pepper flakes and simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/baked-ziti-with-sausage.html#wprm-recipe-72134-step-0-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the cream, \u2153 cup (33 g) of the pecorino Romano, cooked sausage, and basil to the pan; stir until evenly combined. Carefully pour the contents of the saut\u00e9 pan into the large pot with the pasta and gently stir to combine. Spoon half of the mixture into a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33-cm) baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the shredded mozzarella (1 cup/113 g) and half the remaining pecorino Romano (1\u00bd tablespoons). Spoon the remaining pasta mixture on top and sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella (1 cup/113 g) and pecorino Romano (1\u00bd tablespoons). Transfer to the oven and bake, uncovered, until the cheese has melted and browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Sprinkle with more basil and serve.", "name": "Add the cream, \u2153 cup (33 g) of the pecorino Romano, cooked sausage, and basil to the pan; stir until evenly combined. Carefully pour the contents of the saut\u00e9 pan into the large pot with the pasta and gently stir to combine. Spoon half of the mixture into a 9 x 13-inch (23 x 33-cm) baking dish. Sprinkle with half of the shredded mozzarella (1 cup/113 g) and half the remaining pecorino Romano (1\u00bd tablespoons). Spoon the remaining pasta mixture on top and sprinkle with the remaining mozzarella (1 cup/113 g) and pecorino Romano (1\u00bd tablespoons). Transfer to the oven and bake, uncovered, until the cheese has melted and browned, 15 to 20 minutes. Discard the solids and pour the clear broth back into the pot. (Alternatively, you can use a fine mesh spider to fish out the solids.) ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/quick-beef-pho.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring the broth to a boil and add the noodles; cook until the noodles are just tender, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Using tongs or a spider, lift the noodles from the pot and divide evenly into bowls. Reduce the heat to a simmer and add the sliced beef to the broth; let simmer until no longer pink, about 1 minute. Using a slotted spoon or spider, remove the beef from the broth and divide between the bowls. Taste the broth and adjust the seasoning with salt, if necessary. Ladle the broth over the noodles and beef. Top each bowl with the reserved thinly sliced onions, bean sprouts, and cilantro (you may not need all of the onions). Pass the lime wedges, hoisin, and sriracha at the table.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/quick-beef-pho.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make-Ahead/Freezing Instructions: The broth can be made in advance and actually develops more flavor as it sits. Simply prepare the broth according to the recipe, allow it to cool, and then store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or freeze it for up to 3 months. When ready to serve, reheat the broth to a simmer, then proceed with assembling your pho bowls with noodles, beef, and toppings.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/quick-beef-pho.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}], "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium yellow onion, quartered, divided", "1 (14.5 oz) can low-sodium beef broth (1\u00be cups)", "1 (14.5 oz) can low-sodium chicken broth (1\u00be cups)", "2 cups water", "1 tablespoon fish sauce", "1 (1-inch) piece fresh ginger, thinly sliced (no need to peel)", "1 cinnamon stick", "2 teaspoons sugar", "1 star anise pod", "4 whole cloves", "7 oz flat rice noodles", "8 oz very thinly sliced beef, such as flat iron or flank steak", " Salt, to taste", "\u00bd cup bean sprouts", "\u00bc cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves", " Lime wedges, for serving", " Hoisin sauce and sriracha, for serving"], "recipeYield": "2 dinner-size bowls or 4 small bowls", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/02/pho-1200x1478.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/02/pho-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/02/pho-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2023/02/pho-480x270.jpg"], "citation": "Adapted from <a href=\"https://amzn.to/3m1bZkq\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener sponsored\">Bowls: Vibrant Recipes with Endless Possibilities</a> by America's Test Kitchen", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "ratingValue": 5, "ratingCount": "34"}, "datePublished": "2023-03-02T08:18:00-05:00", "keywords": "Better-Than-Take Out, Comfort Food, Fall, Fish Sauce, Sriracha, Winter", "recipeCuisine": "Asian, Vietnamese", "recipeCategory": "Recipes"}]

"HowToStep", "text": "Line a 13 x 9-inch baking dish with wide heavy-duty aluminum foil, allowing a slight overhang on each side.", "url": Seal the bag, making sure to press out all the air. Use a rolling pin to gently pound the candy into small pieces. Do your best not to pulverize the candy; small pieces look prettier on the bark (you should have just shy of \u00bd cup pieces).", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/marbled-peppermint-bark.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium bowl, heat the semi-sweet chocolate chips in microwave at 50 percent power until mostly melted, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir until smooth. In a second medium bowl, repeat with white chocolate chips. Note that the chips may not appear melted after the full cooking time in the microwave, but when you stir them, you'll find that they're very soft and will melt quickly once stirred. <strong>(Pro Tip: When working with chocolate, be sure your bowls and utensils are completely dry. Water is the enemy of melted chocolate and will cause it to seize up.)</strong>", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/marbled-peppermint-bark.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a rubber spatula to scrape the melted semi-sweet chocolate into the prepared baking dish and smooth the top, making sure to get all the way to the corners of the dish.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/marbled-peppermint-bark.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drizzle the melted white chocolate in ribbons over the entire semi-sweet chocolate layer.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/marbled-peppermint-bark.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drag the tip of a butter knife through the chocolate to create swirls, lifting the semi-sweet chocolate over the white chocolate to create nice marbling. Be careful not to swirl too much \u2013 less is more here! You can fry them on the stovetop or in the oven\u2014your choice!", "datePublished": "2024-12-12T07:02:35+00:00", "image": ["https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/12/latkes-2.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/12/latkes-2-500x500.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/12/latkes-2-500x375.jpg", "https://www.onceuponachef.com/images/2011/12/latkes-2-480x270.jpg"], "recipeYield": ["18", "18 latkes"], "prepTime": "PT30M", "cookTime": "PT30M", "totalTime": "PT60M", "recipeIngredient": ["2 pounds russet potatoes ((2 to 3 potatoes))", "1  medium yellow onion, (peeled (about the size of a baseball))", "2  large eggs", "1\u00bd teaspoons salt", "2 teaspoons baking powder", "\u00bc cup all-purpose flour", "Vegetable oil, (for frying)", "Sour cream and applesauce, (for serving)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If using the oven method, preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) and set two oven racks in the centermost positions.", "name": "If using the oven method, preheat the oven to 425\u00b0F (220\u00b0C) and set two oven racks in the centermost positions.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/latkes.html#wprm-recipe-73110-step-0-0"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the Batter: Peel the potatoes, then coarsely grate them with the onion together using a food processor fitted with the grating blade\u2014or by hand, using a box grater. Place the potato and onion mixture in a fine sieve over the sink or a large bowl and press down firmly with a wad of paper towels or a clean dishcloth to wring out excess moisture. Stir and repeat a few times with fresh paper towels until the liquid is mostly drained. Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the potato and onion mixture, salt, baking powder, and flour. Mix until evenly combined.", "name": "Make the Batter: Peel the potatoes, then coarsely grate them with the onion together using a food processor fitted with the grating blade\u2014or by hand, using a box grater. Place the potato and onion mixture in a fine sieve over the sink or a large bowl and press down firmly with a wad of paper towels or a clean dishcloth to wring out excess moisture. Stir and repeat a few times with fresh paper towels until the liquid is mostly drained. Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Add the potato and onion mixture, salt, baking powder, and flour. Mix until evenly combined.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/latkes.html#wprm-recipe-73110-step-0-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fry the Latkes:Stovetop Method: In a large cast iron or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat about \u00bc cup (60 ml) of oil. Once the oil is hot and shimmering, drop mounds of batter (about 3 tablespoons) into the hot pan (the batter should sizzle when you drop it in). Flatten the mounds slightly with a spatula. Reduce the heat to medium and cook until the bottom of the latkes are golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until the second side is golden, another 4 to 5 minutes, adjusting the heat as necessary. Transfer the latkes to a baking sheet lined with paper towels to drain. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil as necessary.Oven Method: Fill two heavy nonstick rimmed baking sheets with \u00bd cup oil each (see note). Place the pans in the oven for 10 minutes to heat the oil. Wearing oven mitts, very carefully remove the pans from the oven. Drop mounds of batter (about 3 tablespoons) onto the baking sheets, spacing the latkes about 1\u00bd inches (4 cm) apart. Using the back of a spoon, press down on the latkes to flatten just slightly. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the bottoms are crisp and golden. Carefully remove the pans from oven and flip the latkes (tongs are the best tool as a spatula may cause oil to splatter). Place the pans back in the oven and cook until the latkes are crisp and golden brown all over, about 10 minutes more. Remove the pans from the oven and transfer the latkes to a baking sheet lined with paper towels.", "name": "Fry the Latkes:Stovetop Method: In a large cast iron or nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat about \u00bc cup (60 ml) of oil. Once the oil is hot and shimmering, drop mounds of batter (about 3 tablespoons) into the hot pan (the batter should sizzle when you drop it in). Flatten the mounds slightly with a spatula. Reduce the heat to medium and cook until the bottom of the latkes are golden brown and crispy, about 5 minutes. Flip and cook until the second side is golden, another 4 to 5 minutes, adjusting the heat as necessary. Transfer the latkes to a baking sheet lined with paper towels to drain. Repeat with the remaining batter, adding more oil as necessary.Oven Method: Fill two heavy nonstick rimmed baking sheets with \u00bd cup oil each (see note). Place the pans in the oven for 10 minutes to heat the oil. Wearing oven mitts, very carefully remove the pans from the oven. Drop mounds of batter (about 3 tablespoons) onto the baking sheets, spacing the latkes about 1\u00bd inches (4 cm) apart. Using the back of a spoon, press down on the latkes to flatten just slightly. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, or until the bottoms are crisp and golden. Carefully remove the pans from oven and flip the latkes (tongs are the best tool as a spatula may cause oil to splatter). Place the pans back in the oven and cook until the latkes are crisp and golden brown all over, about 10 minutes more. "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "It's important to stick with quick-cooking oats which are rolled oats that have been coarsely chopped. Regular old-fashioned oats are too coarse and chewy for this recipe and cause the bars to fall apart. If you don\u2019t have any quick-cooking oats in your pantry, you can make your own by pulsing regular oatmeal in the food processor a few times.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chewy-chocolate-chip-granola-bars.html#faq-question-1707851135166", "position": 2, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chewy-chocolate-chip-granola-bars.html#faq-question-1707851135166", "name": "Can I make the granola bars ahead of time?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Sure! Store the bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. If you have to stack the granola bars, be sure to use parchment paper or foil in between the layers; otherwise, they'll stick together and fall apart. They can also be frozen for up to 3 months. Before serving, move them to the refrigerator to thaw.", "inLanguage": "en-US"}, "inLanguage": "en-US"}, {"@type": "Question", "@id": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chewy-chocolate-chip-granola-bars.html#faq-question-1707852477239", "position": 3, "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/chewy-chocolate-chip-granola-bars.html#faq-question-1707852477239", "name": "Are there any variations or substitutions I can try?", "answerCount": 1, "acceptedAnswer": {"@type": "Answer", "text": "Yes, these bars offer great versatility. Similarly, if almonds aren't to your taste or if you are dealing with a nut allergy, swap them out for unsalted sunflower seeds. Add the brown sugar and stir until dissolved; set aside.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/soft-pretzels.html#fv-recipe-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, combine the flour, yeast, and fine salt. Mix on low speed until well combined, about 1 minute. With the mixer on low, gradually add the warm milk/butter mixture to the bowl. When the dough forms a cohesive mass, switch from the paddle attachment to the dough hook. Knead on medium-low speed until the dough is smooth but still slightly tacky, about 5 minutes. (Alternatively, the dough can be mixed and kneaded by hand.) Shape the dough into a ball, place in a clean, lightly greased bowl, and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm spot until doubled in size, 1 to 2 hours. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/soft-pretzels.html#fv-recipe-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 450\u00b0F. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/soft-pretzels.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a 2-qt baking dish, combine the baking soda with 2\u00bc cups warm water. Stir until the baking soda is dissolved; set aside. (Dipping the pretzel dough in a baking soda solution gives the pretzels a nice golden brown crust.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/soft-pretzels.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Punch the dough to deflate it, then turn it out onto a clean work surface. (If the dough seems sticky, you can dust it with a bit of flour as needed.) Shape the dough into a log, then cut into 6 equal pieces; cover with a damp dishtowel so the dough doesn't dry out. Roll and stretch each piece with the palms of your hands into a 24-inch rope, holding the ends and slapping the middle of the rope on the counter as you stretch.  ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/soft-pretzels.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using two hands, gently dip each \"rope\" into the soda solution. Let any excess liquid drip off, then form the dough into a pretzel shape directly on the prepared baking sheet (form a U-shape, then holding the ends of the rope, cross them over and under each other -- making a twist in the center -- and press the ends onto the bottom of the pretzel). Sprinkle evenly with the coarse salt. Bake until golden, 8 to 12 minutes; watch the bottoms carefully as they can burn. ", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/soft-pretzels.html#fv-recipe-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter and brush on the baked pretzels. Add the oats and cook, stirring frequently, until the oats turn golden and fragrant, 6 to 8 minutes. Transfer the oats to a food processor fitted with the metal blade and process into a fine meal. Add the flour, salt, cinnamon, baking powder, and baking soda to the oats and pulse until the mixture is uniform.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oat-muffins-pecan-streusel-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the remaining 6 tablespoons of butter. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the melted butter and brown sugar until smooth. Add the milk and eggs and whisk until the mixture is smooth (if you have lumps, I find it helpful to warm the mixture a bit in the microwave.) Gradually add the flour/oat mixture to the wet ingredients, stirring gently with the whisk until the dry ingredients are evenly moistened. Do not over-mix; the batter will look a little lumpy -- that's okay. You will notice that the batter is very thin; let it sit for 20 minutes to thicken (don't worry -- it will thicken quite a bit). Meanwhile, adjust an oven rack to the middle position and preheat the oven to 375\u00b0F.", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oat-muffins-pecan-streusel-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Using an ice cream scoop with a wire scraper or large spoon, divide the batter equally into the muffin cups; they will be filled to the rim. Evenly sprinkle the streusel topping over the batter. Bake until golden and domed, and a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 22 to 25 minutes. (If your oven has hot spots, rotate the muffin tin halfway through baking.)", "url": "https://www.onceuponachef.com/recipes/oat-muffins-pecan-streusel-topping.html#fv-recipe-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the muffins cool in the pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
